II.iii.3.B.1.a
.
Receiving Valid Notice of a Change of Contact or Direct Deposit Information
Claims processors may receive valid change of contact information or direct deposit notification via one of the methods identified in the table below.
Type of Information Being Updated
Valid Notices
Contact
A signed statement from the claimant
telephone contact with the claimant, after identity has been verified following guidance in
Identification (ID) Protocol Requirements
obtained while processing undeliverable mail following the guidance in
M21-1, Part II, Subpart i, 2.C.6.d
VA Form 20-572, Request for Change of Address/Cancellation of Direct Deposit
other Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) forms that contain the information
claimant data
in the Veteran’s Information Solution (VIS) web application, and/or
provided via VA-approved claims submission services or websites such as VA.gov or Vet360
telephone, written, or in-person communication by an appointed Veterans service organization (VSO), agent, or attorney when authorized in
Block 21 of
VA Form 21-22,
Appointment of Veterans Service Organization as Claimant's Representative
, or
Block 21 of
VA Form 21-22a,
Appointment of Individual as Claimant's Representative
, and
a signed statement or telephone contact with the third party identified on a valid
VA Form 21-0845, Authorization to Disclose Personal Information to a Third Party
, when
Any Information
in Block 11 is checked,
or
Limited Information
in Block 11
and
Change of address or direct deposit
in Block 12 are checked.
Direct Deposit
VA claim submission forms containing direct deposit information fields where the claimant has provided direct deposit information specified by the form
Standard Form (SF) 1199A, Direct Deposit Sign-Up Form
, and
VA Form 20-572
.
Important
:
Section 3 of
SF
1199A
must be completed by the financial institution, not the claimant, in order to be deemed valid.
Claimants may contact the National Call Center (NCC) or use VA-approved claims submission services or websites such as VA.gov to make direct deposit updates without claims processor involvement.  A third party authorized on a valid
VA Form 21-0845
may also contact the NCC to request this update.
Participants in pre-discharge claim programs may also contact VA Military Services Coordinators or other VA pre-discharge (Benefits Delivery at Discharge (BDD), BDD-excluded, or Integrated Disability Evaluation System) intake site employees to establish or update direct deposit.  A third party authorized on a valid
VA Form 21-0845
may also contact the intake site to request this update.  These direct deposit updates may also be accepted over the telephone, provided the pre-discharge intake site verifies the caller’s identify following guidance in
Identification (ID) Protocol Requirements
.
When VA receives a request for a direct deposit change that does not meet the criteria noted above, send the claimant an
Invalid Direct Deposit Update
letter, but
do not
update any of the direct deposit information in VA systems.
Exception
:  Only fiduciary hub (hub) employees are able to change an address or direct deposit information if the beneficiary has a fiduciary.
Note
:  Update addresses, other contact details, and direct deposit and payment information in Veterans Benefits Management System (VBMS) when possible.
References
:  For more information on
the definition of a pre-discharge intake site, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart i, 6.B.3.a
identifying if a beneficiary has a fiduciary, and the required actions upon receiving a valid change of contact notice or direct deposit information, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 3.B.1.c
address changes for incompetent Veterans by a power of attorney or fiduciary, see
M27-1, Part I, 7.5.j
undeliverable mail procedures, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart i, 2.C
change of contact information and direct deposit request procedures, see
M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, 3.B.1.b
, and
M27-1, Part 1, 3.12
handling suspicious or incomplete direct deposit changes, see the
Direct Deposit Tip Sheet
, and
reviewing claimant data in VIS, see the
VIS User Guide
.
